intro: Pulicaria tanganyikensis, commonly known as the Tanganyika pulicaria, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Tanzania. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
